posts.post_content: Or you could just run some [Birds of Paradise](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Birds of Paradise)/[Orochi Leafcaller](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Orochi Leafcaller) for your [Distortion Strike](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Distortion Strike). If it's that important.

Posted By: BastianQoU (9/7/2011 3:39:09 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Back then, unblockability was a huge thing - see my discourse on [Teleport](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Teleport) vs. [Distortion Strike](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Distortion Strike).
  
   
Se, yes, it is strongly overcosted by today's standards, but as mentioned, green is still best at shelling out the mana, so 4CC is not too bad to get a hugy fatty through. And while most green fatties do have trample, this could net you the needed few extra points of damage. 2/5.
posts.html:
Back then, unblockability was a huge thing - see my discourse on Teleport vs. Distortion Strike.

Se, yes, it is strongly overcosted by today's standards, but as mentioned, green is still best at shelling out the mana, so 4CC is not too bad to get a hugy fatty through. And while most green fatties do have trample, this could net you the needed few extra points of damage. 2/5.

Posted By: Lord_of_Tresserhorn (3/9/2012 8:54:23 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
This card is rather unplayable indeed.  
  
But it has cool flavor. I mean think about it. It's pretty cool to imagine a game that has "trailblazers" as a fundamental type of creatures that are meant for getting through your opponent's defenses with ease and before the others.  
  
Also i think some new players (or at least when this card was printed) would overrate this card and totally love it.  
I used to have much respect for creatures that had powerful evasive abilities aside from flying to damage the opponent (like *Shadow*, [Rhox](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rhox)'s ability, or simply being unblockable.)  
  
I also remember freaking out when i first saw [Cloak of Mists](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cloak of Mists) and totally couldn't understand how this wasn't a rare card.  
Which is kind of funny since Trailblazer is rare yet costs twice as much, is only temporarily and you can barely make use of the fact that it's an instant. (Some might now argue with the color pie and say it's rare because it's something green usually cann... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:

But it has cool flavor. I mean think about it. It's pretty cool to imagine a game that has "trailblazers" as a fundamental type of creatures that are meant for getting through your opponent's defenses with ease and before the others.

Also i think some new players (or at least when this card was printed) would overrate this card and totally love it.
I used to have much respect for creatures that had powerful evasive abilities aside from flying to damage the opponent (like Shadow, Rhox's ability, or simply being unblockable.)

I also remember freaking out when i first saw Cloak of Mists and totally couldn't understand how this wasn't a rare card.
Which is kind of funny since Trailblazer is rare yet costs twice as much, is only temporarily and you can barely make use of the fact that it's an instant. (Some might now argue with the color pie and say it's rare because it's something green usually cann... (see all)

4CC implies a 6-mana casting cost (i.e. 4GG). Please use the already established ways of notating mana costs. C = colored mana, so Trailblazer is 2CC, Ball Lightning is CCC, and so on.

I think this deserves a little better than a 1.

2/5 (hey I didn't say it was great or anything)
